Package controller

Class CustomersTableController

java.lang.Object
controller.CustomersTableController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class CustomersTableController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is an FXML Controller class which provides functionality to the Customers Table screen (the Customers Table FXML file).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    addButton
    The "Add" button on the Customers Table page, which leads the user to the "Add Customer" page (where they can add a new customer, which gets added to the database [and is also visible in the Customers TableView]).
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    backButton
    The back button on the Customers Table page, which leads the user back to the Main Menu.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,String>
    custCountryColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the country where the customer resides.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,String>
    custDivisionColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the first-level division (as in country division) where the customer resides.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,Integer>
    custIdColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the customer ID of each customer.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,String>
    custNameColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the full name of each customer.
    private javafx.scene.control.Label
    customerRecordsLabel
    This is the header for the Customers Table screen; it reads "Customer Records".
    private javafx.scene.control.TableView<Customers>
    customersTableView
    The TableView where users will see a list of all customer records that are currently in the database.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,String>
    custPhoneNumberColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the phone number of each customer.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,String>
    custPostalCodeColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the postal code of each customer.
    private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Customers,String>
    custStreetAddressColumn
    The column of the Customers TableView that displays the street address of each customer.
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    deleteButton
    The "Delete" button on the Customers Table page, which deletes the selected customer from the database (this is also reflected in the Customers TableView).
    private boolean
    localLanguageIsFrench
    Denotes whether the local language is French or a different language.
    (package private) DataHolder
    methodsLibrary
    An instantiation of the DataHolder class; this is necessary in order to call the methods that allow the application to switch to a different scene, as those methods cannot be static (and thus, an instance of the class is required in order to call those methods).
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    modifyButton
    The "Modify" button on the Customers Table page, which leads the user to the "Modify Customer" page (where they can update an existing customer record that they have selected; the changes to the customer record are then saved to the database [and are also visible in the Customers TableView]).
    private javafx.scene.control.Button
    signOutButton
    The "Sign Out" button on the Customers Table page, which leads the user back to the Login Screen.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
    Initializes the controller class.
    private void
    onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Delete" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box to to the user (asking if they are sure that they want to delete the customer record that they previously selected), and if the user clicks "OK", the customer is deleted from the database (and since the Customers TableView pulls its contents directly from the database, the Customers TableView will reflect this deletion as well).
    private void
    onActionDisplayAddCustomerMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Add" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it switches the visible screen to the "Add Customer" screen, from where the user can add a new customer.
    private void
    onActionDisplayLoginScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Sign out" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box asking the user if they are sure they want to sign out, and if the user confirms, then this method switches the visible screen to be the Login Screen once again.
    private void
    onActionDisplayMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Back" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it switches the visible screen back to the "Main Menu" screen.
    private void
    onActionDisplayModifyCustomerMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    This method gets called whenever the "Modify" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; if the user selected an appointment from the Customers TableView prior to clicking the "Modify" button, then this method switches the visible screen to the "Modify Customer" screen, from where the user can make modifications to the customer record that they selected.
    private void
    translateScreenToFrench()
    This method is called if the user's local language is determined to be French; it translates all components on the Customers Table screen to French.

    • localLanguageIsFrench

      private boolean localLanguageIsFrench
      Denotes whether the local language is French or a different language. If this variable is true, the application gets translated to French; otherwise (if this variable is false), the application remains in English.

    • methodsLibrary

      DataHolder methodsLibrary
      An instantiation of the DataHolder class; this is necessary in order to call the methods that allow the application to switch to a different scene, as those methods cannot be static (and thus, an instance of the class is required in order to call those methods).

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomersTableController

      public CustomersTableController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class. This is essentially the controller's equivalent of the "main()" method. This method lets the Customers TableView know what Observable List (of Customer objects) it will be displaying; it also lets each column of the Customers TableView know what variable of each Customer object it should display. Finally, this method determines the ZoneId, Locale, and local language (based on the retrieved Locale) of the current user; using this information, this method decides whether or not to translate the Customers Table screen to French.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • translateScreenToFrench

      private void translateScreenToFrench()
      This method is called if the user's local language is determined to be French; it translates all components on the Customers Table screen to French.

    • onActionDisplayAddCustomerMenu

      private void onActionDisplayAddCustomerMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Add" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it switches the visible screen to the "Add Customer" screen, from where the user can add a new customer.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Add" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene), which is used in the process of switching screens

    • onActionDisplayModifyCustomerMenu

      private void onActionDisplayModifyCustomerMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Modify" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; if the user selected an appointment from the Customers TableView prior to clicking the "Modify" button, then this method switches the visible screen to the "Modify Customer" screen, from where the user can make modifications to the customer record that they selected. Otherwise (if the user did not select a customer record prior to clicking the "Modify" button), an error message is output to the user informing them that they must first select a customer record before clicking the "Modify" button. Additionally, this method sends all of the data in the customer record from the Customers Table screen to the Modify Customer screen (it does this by creating an instance of the Modify Customers controller, using that instance to call the "setInputFieldsToContentOfSelectedCustomer()" method [which is declared in the Modify Customers controller] and passing the entire selected item [which is a Customers object] into that method [so that the Modify Customer controller now has access to the item that was just selected] ).
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Modify" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene), which is used in the process of switching screens

    • onActionDeleteCustomer

      private void onActionDeleteCustomer(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method gets called whenever the "Delete" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box to to the user (asking if they are sure that they want to delete the customer record that they previously selected), and if the user clicks "OK", the customer is deleted from the database (and since the Customers TableView pulls its contents directly from the database, the Customers TableView will reflect this deletion as well). If the user did not select a customer record in the TableView prior to clicking on the "Delete" button, this method outputs an error dialog box telling the user that they must select a customer record to delete before clicking on the "Delete" button. Additionally, before the customer record is actually deleted from the database, all of the customer's appointments are deleted from the database first (so that there aren't any appointments scheduled for customers that don't exist). This helps maintain referential integrity of the database.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Delete" button was clicked.

    • onActionDisplayMainMenu

      private void onActionDisplayMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Back" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it switches the visible screen back to the "Main Menu" screen.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Back" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene), which is used in the process of switching screens

    • onActionDisplayLoginScreen

      private void onActionDisplayLoginScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method gets called whenever the "Sign out" button on the Customers Table screen is clicked by the user; it outputs a confirmation dialog box asking the user if they are sure they want to sign out, and if the user confirms, then this method switches the visible screen to be the Login Screen once again.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that occurred; in this case, the "Sign out" button was clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - Thrown by the FXMLLoader's "load()" method (if an error occurs while loading the desired scene), which is used in the process of switching screens
